headline: Slow Cooker Filipino Chicken Adobo
description: This flavorful chicken adobo is a Filipino favorite, made quickly and easily by using simple ingredients and a slow cooker.
name: Slow Cooker Filipino Chicken Adobo

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken thighs, peppercorns, garlic, bay leaves, soy sauce, and vinegar into the bottom of a slow cooker in that order, making sure peppercorns and bay leaves are submerged into the liquid.
Cover and cook on High until chicken thighs are no longer pink in the centers, about 5 hours. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone of a thigh should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: If you use the FILIPINO Soy Sauce and FILIPINO Vinegar, both of which have a VERY DIFFERENT flavor profile from Japanese (Kikkoman or La Choy) soy sauce and American distilled white vinegar, plus use boneless thigh meat instead of (dry) breast meat, I am sure you will LOVE this recipe, too.
Tastes like pickled pig's feet. This is the worst recipe I ever got off the internet. I will no longer rely on Allrecipes.com as a source.

Very tasty and gets better in fridge. Couldn't be easier to prepare. One major caveat: the recipe neglects seasoning. You gotta add some salt! (Or your family/guests/you will!) Another ththi to note: there will be a huge amount of chicken fat floating on top. Now rendered seasoned and flavored chicken fat is a mighty tasty thing, but most of us would probably prefer to dispense with most of it, so you will need to skim the fat on top, or, for preference, cool the cooked dish in the fridge, and then easily skim the fat on top when it is cool and congealed. Just sayin'....

My husband thought it was good so I will probably make it again because it is super simple. I personally thought it lacked a complexity of flavors. Will add onion next time as other reviewers did, and maybe experiment with some different spices.
Not a good aroma nor taste. Followed the recipe exactly. The strong flavor of the vinegar was a turn off. My husband ate only some of i. We love filipino dishes, so this was a surprise.

Made this tonight. After reading comments I added a sweet onion on the bottom, and added a squirt of ginger paste for a dash more flavor. Used boneless thighs and cooked about 3 hours. It was really good! Definitely will make again.

I live in the Philippines and a lot of the food is salty and vinegary. I use a Cook's Illustrated version with coconut milk and even then, it was too salty and vinegary. So, I cut the soy sauce and vinegar in half and found the sweet spot. Oh, it doesn't take FIVE hours to cook it either. I didn't try this recipe, because I knew how it would taste.
As I Filipino no , bland too much vinegar . No flavor sorry

Great dish. Super simple and very flavorful. We do keto so we skipped the rice and added veggies. To the reviewer who said they made “NO” changes but then proceeded to use boneless skinless chicken thighs (which is, in fact, a CHANGE)..common sense would tell you that food with bone-in take longer to cook than boneless. Perhaps learn basic cooking skills before leaving senseless reviews.

Love how a reviewer emphatically says she made NO changes to the recipe then in the next sentence so she used boneless chicken. Right there is one change that could affect the cooking time that she complained about. People have to remember not all crockpots are created equal. Older ones take longer to cook. I think this recipe is just fine as written and in my crock pot 1 hour on High and 4 hours on low was sufficient.

I made NO changes to recipe. I did use the skinless boneless chicken. My opinion is the cook time is wrong. 5 hrs on high was too long, chicken came out so dry it was hard to swallow. Also seemed like too much vinegar. Would not make again using this recipe.

This is great recipe... simple to make, different, flexible and delicious. One the day I made this, my local stores were out of bay leaf. Instead, I added sweet onion and served it over rice. Side dishes of broccoli and yellow squash with some of the adobo sauce. I can imagine lots of otherway to use this recipe as a foundation, much like a good basic chicken curry recipe lends itself to almost endless improvisation.
It really is as simple to make as the recipe states. I added half of a sliced sweet onion to line the bottom of the slow cooker and it turned out great. The whole family loved this dish.
My husband love this new dish
This was an awesome dish! Very flavorful!
